content: I found a little saying that I think might well describe the thoughts of the Somali Pirates. Bartholomew Roberts, 1722 "In honost service, there are commonly low wages and hard labour; in this - plenty, satiety, pleasure and ease, liberty and power. Who would not balance credit on this side, when all the hazard that is run for it, at worst, is only a sour look or twoo on choking? No, a merry life and a short one, that's my motto." When you think about the situation, the pirates over there are given a choice ofpiracy or nothing...Black Barts' words are very true for them... “If you bring these leaders to trial, it will condemn the North, for by the Constitution, secession is not rebellion...His (Jeff Davis') capture was a mistake. His trial will be a greater one. We cannot convict him of treason." Chief Justice Salmon P. Chase, 1867.

content: Don't think that the Rangers were taken out by a bunch of chumps. You do them discredit. When we go by land we put boots on the dirt, not just air. Don't underestimate the Somali. We need to consider that we are going up against some very good light Infantry. We come with Air, Arty, Armour, and Grunts. The whole show. Get in, do it right, do it quick, get out. Repeat as necessary. But we can't leave it a pile of rubble either. We don't need to create another hatchery for terrorism so we have to nation build. No real choice. But we extend the olive branch after we break all his arrows. I remember Gen. Westmoreland was shown a picture of Gen Giap. Westy said he was gonna kick that little rice-burner's azz. History shows that was not to be. Never underestimate.

title: Pirates declare war on US Vessels.

content: quote: Originally posted by ANZACbiscuit: If you and your children were starving poor, and there was no police force within a thousand miles of your home, you would be a lot more likely to grab your colt and rip off the local 7/11, right? That's just how life is! These guys may be 'riff-raff', but no more than your typical baltimore stick up artist (yes, I've been watching The Wire on DVD ). Also, they're not homicidal - pirates have killed virtually no-one on any of their attacks. they just want the cash money. As to the second post, yeah; describing the population of an entire country as 'only understanding violence' is racist. But hey, that wasn't against you. Stopping crime - permanently? That's sweeping leaves on a windy day. - I'll grant you that in the absense of the law, prosecution and incarceration, "desparate" people will do desparate things. Those pirates, we are told, are teens, if not high on substances, then high on "visions of grandure", pirate adventure and over-inflated ego (no, no links, just my own imagination). The character of the man is revealed by the choices he makes. A man of "bad" character will choose "badly" and should pay the price. I like to think that I would take my .45 and harvest some food for my starving kids rather than wreck havoc on the high seas. I have to wonder how many of those lethally armed "kids" are assulting ships to provide for their kids and how many are doing it for "pleasure and treasure". They may say "gimme yore moneyand I'll go away" but if you resist, they've demonstrated their willingness to f'n kill you. In my lexicon, racism is harboring irrational beliefs about an entire race of humans (you know, the white, black, brown, yellow, purple thing). I'm sure there is an appropriate word for irrational, disparaging attitudes towards some nation...like France...or Nam...or K, etc. Of course one cannot hope to stop crime but one can reduce the numbers of those perpetrating it...even if it's one at a time, as we have seen. Besides, I have a hard time lumping these acts of piracy into any catagory of crime I see comitted. Basically, it's acts of war committed against soverign nations...punishable by death.

content: I found a little saying that I think might well describe the thoughts of the Somali Pirates. Bartholomew Roberts, 1722 "In honost service, there are commonly low wages and hard labour; in this - plenty, satiety, pleasure and ease, liberty and power. Who would not balance credit on this side, when all the hazard that is run for it, at worst, is only a sour look or twoo on choking? No, a merry life and a short one, that's my motto." When you think about the situation, the pirates over there are given a choice ofpiracy or nothing...Black Barts' words are very true for them... “If you bring these leaders to trial, it will condemn the North, for by the Constitution, secession is not rebellion...His (Jeff Davis') capture was a mistake. His trial will be a greater one. We cannot convict him of treason." Chief Justice Salmon P. Chase, 1867.

content: Don't think that the Rangers were taken out by a bunch of chumps. You do them discredit. When we go by land we put boots on the dirt, not just air. Don't underestimate the Somali. We need to consider that we are going up against some very good light Infantry. We come with Air, Arty, Armour, and Grunts. The whole show. Get in, do it right, do it quick, get out. Repeat as necessary. But we can't leave it a pile of rubble either. We don't need to create another hatchery for terrorism so we have to nation build. No real choice. But we extend the olive branch after we break all his arrows. I remember Gen. Westmoreland was shown a picture of Gen Giap. Westy said he was gonna kick that little rice-burner's azz. History shows that was not to be. Never underestimate.

That's sweeping leaves on a windy day. -

title: Pirates declare war on US Vessels.

content: quote: Originally posted by ANZACbiscuit: If you and your children were starving poor, and there was no police force within a thousand miles of your home, you would be a lot more likely to grab your colt and rip off the local 7/11, right? That's just how life is! These guys may be 'riff-raff', but no more than your typical baltimore stick up artist (yes, I've been watching The Wire on DVD ). Also, they're not homicidal - pirates have killed virtually no-one on any of their attacks. they just want the cash money. As to the second post, yeah; describing the population of an entire country as 'only understanding violence' is racist. But hey, that wasn't against you. Stopping crime - permanently? That's sweeping leaves on a windy day. - I'll grant you that in the absense of the law, prosecution and incarceration, "desparate" people will do desparate things. Those pirates, we are told, are teens, if not high on substances, then high on "visions of grandure", pirate adventure and over-inflated ego (no, no links, just my own imagination). The character of the man is revealed by the choices he makes. A man of "bad" character will choose "badly" and should pay the price. I like to think that I would take my .45 and harvest some food for my starving kids rather than wreck havoc on the high seas. I have to wonder how many of those lethally armed "kids" are assulting ships to provide for their kids and how many are doing it for "pleasure and treasure". They may say "gimme yore moneyand I'll go away" but if you resist, they've demonstrated their willingness to f'n kill you. In my lexicon, racism is harboring irrational beliefs about an entire race of humans (you know, the white, black, brown, yellow, purple thing). I'm sure there is an appropriate word for irrational, disparaging attitudes towards some nation...like France...or Nam...or K, etc. Of course one cannot hope to stop crime but one can reduce the numbers of those perpetrating it...even if it's one at a time, as we have seen. Besides, I have a hard time lumping these acts of piracy into any catagory of crime I see comitted. Basically, it's acts of war committed against soverign nations...punishable by death.
